content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice job! Lots of comments below.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The description is clear. The tests are well done and the constraints are relevant.  As claimed, everything can be solved with just logic. The difficulty is reasonable and the puzzle is original and engaging.

I wanted to validate this one but the last time I approved a puzzle @5DN1L made the remark that duplicate testcases should be frowned upon.

If you could change the last couple pixel art validators I'll gladly approve it.

... I know it's a bit unfortunate to have to change a validator that is supposed to be an ascii drawing but oh well.

Edit: they were actually different. A simple ctr+f was enough to check it. Shame, shame, shame.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun puzzle, statement is clear & easy to understand and the difficulty level is adequate.
I've added an ascii-art one, just for fun... more?

I suggest to add this block taken from the 10x10 test to make the debugging easier (ideally before the 10x10 test):

4
.00.
..3.
.432
....

....
....
####
#...

The reason being this piece of code (not cleaned, expires in 1 week):

https://bpa.st/JJRQ

Without the "Case 3" part it passes everything up to test 10x10, but then debugging that big of a grid gets really tedious. This small test should help in figuring that "Case 3" is just wrong logic and should be removed. You can try yourself by uncommenting / commenting that part.

Great puzzle nevertheless, I'm curious to know how you generated the big grids.
Great puzzle! I made an error that didn't show up until 25x25. Obviously, the bigger the grid, the tougher the debugging.

I haven't coded a line yet, but I assume the solution for each test is unique? That is, we are granted to not be given something like:
2
1.
..

Edit: It also seems that each coordinate has at least one number in its neighbourhood, which looks reasonable to me, otherwise, again, the solution may not be unique. Maybe this should be stated somewhere?

Your contribution has been uploaded twice. Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/76543bf2c7cbc7e3bdccbedef12ac4d6428fa

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.
Done and done. (When I was submitting it first I got a 5xx error, so submitted it again - apologies that it didn't occur to me to check if it'd actually worked!)
Yep, it's possible to make a mosaic-like scenario with more than one solution, or with no solutions, but all of these have exactly one. Updated

I thought about this a bit more today. Debugging the 25x25 grid was pretty overwhelming. I found my error by carefully going through my code line by line and really looking for something that could be causing some sort of error. I would have preferred normal debugging. If it's not too hard, would it be possible to add a 15x15 and a 20x20? I'm not 100% sure it would have caught my issue, but it couldn't have hurt.

I really enjoyed your puzzle, so count me in for an approval. I just wanted to talk through my issue and get your thoughts first.
bpa.st link doesn't work for me.

I'm getting an error on the ascii-art. Let's look at the square that is 5 from the left and 4 from the bottom. The input marks that square as an 8. I only see that square touching 7 filled in squares in the solution.
Currently none of the pair of test/validator are identical, for the last 2 there is only one character that changes but they are not duplicate.

Ah sorry, I see now. Did you change it yourself or was it already like that before?

Edit: I just read that @Timinator asked for the changes a couple weeks ago, shame on me. I won't delete the original comment, but instead only replace the edit.

Everything looks great!

Could I ask a very small favor? Would you mind making the ascii art validators just ever so slightly different than the test cases? I honestly don't believe this is a big deal on your puzzle, but in the spirit of following CG guidelines, I'd prefer you fall within guidelines as compared to out and test cases are supposed to be different than validators.
Thanks! Have tweaked the validators of both ascii art tests
Yeah the site was down yesterday, it should work now.

Super interesting. Looks like the idea of "known" and "unknown" threw you for a little loop since a cell that is known to NOT be filled doesn't fit into either category... if I'm looking at it correctly anyway.

I agree with Rafarafa. Great puzzle. Obviously, we both solved it completely as it, but still, a couple more test cases might improve your overall success rate. We all want our puzzles to be challenging, but we also want our test cases to guide as many Codingamers across the finish line as possible.

The case 3 is just wrong logic yeah, the correct version of it should be case 4. In the said test, it fills the top of the grid until it reaches the 4, sees 4 "unknown" (question marks) squares around and proceeds to fill them with #, ignoring that we already filled 3 of those 4 needed before.

Just a bit harder to notice in a 10x10 grid, although it wasn't the end of the world either. Your bug at 25x25 was probably tougher to spot.
I added that scenario as "Careful" but without that final 2 as it's not needed - unless you think that was part of what triggered the issue you faced?

Yeah that is perfect, I don't pass the Careful test. 

Now I do pass the corresponding Validator 4 but I don't think it's a big deal since one would still not pass the 10x10 test nor the 10x10 Validator anyway with this logic, and the whole point was to help the debugging.

I will gladly validate it once you address other's people feedback too.
Have added 15x15 and 20x20; still need to make fresh validators for a couple (marked TBD)
